title: Sarah Jessica Parker avoids fans as she leaves Melbourne Airport
text:
She was mobbed at Sydney Airport this week, prompting her to say that some fans 'freak her out' when they ask for selfies and autographs.

And Sarah Jessica Parker made sure she kept her head down as she prepared to leave the country, no doubt hoping to stay unnoticed by fans.

After a whirlwind tour of the country, the 54-year-old actress kept her head down while making her way through Melbourne Airport.

No time to chat! Sarah Jessica Parker kept her head down as she walked through Melbourne Airport as she left Australia on Friday after a whirlwind promotional tour

Keeping a distance: Sarah has said she much prefers conversation to a selfie and made sure autograph hunters gave her a little space when she arrived at the airport

The Sex And The City star tried to keep a low profile by wearing dark sunglasses.

She looked stylish in a floral dress and accessorised with a trendy cross-body bag and snakeskin heels from her SJP shoe collection.

It comes after Sarah looked particularly uncomfortable at Sydney Airport on Monday when fans flocked towards her looking for selfies.

Low profile: The 54-year-old Sex and the City star kept her head down while surrounded by security and airport staff after saying autograph hunters can 'freak her out'

Looking lovely: Sarah looked stylish in a floral dress and accessorised with a cross-body bag and snakeskin heels from her SJP shoe collection

On Tuesday, Sarah told the Herald Sun that her fans should respect her physical boundaries when asking for photos and autographs.

'The world is scary a little bit right now, there's a heightened awareness, there's tension, so that's the only thing that freaks me out is people grabbing me.

'I much prefer conversation to a selfie,' she said.

She added: 'What's happening now is that people actually grab you, people want a selfie, so there's no exchange of, "Hello, how are you? Do you mind for a moment if we do a photograph?" It's "Can we do a selfie?"

'There's no introduction and when they're doing it they're grabbing you.'

Sarah was in Australia for the launch of her shoe brand, SJP, which is available in department store David Jones.
description: She was mobbed at Sydney Airport this week, prompting her to say that some fans 'freak her out' when they ask for selfies and autographs.
authors: Joe Scek For Daily Mail Australia
